verbs.description: diabolify (third-person singular simple present diabolifies, present participle diabolifying, simple past and past participle diabolified)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To ascribe diabolical qualities to; to change into, or represent as, a devil.
examples: One faction turneth them againſt another; the Lutherane againſt the Calviniſt, and diabolifieth him
